title: Planning a premium upgrade, these smartwatches with metal build caught my eye
snippet: Metal-build smartwatches combine durability with refined design, offering reliable performance, health tracking and a premium feel for everyday wear.

title: Realme 16 Pro to launch in India on Jan 6 with 200MP camera and Dimensity 7300-Max chip: Everything we know so far
snippet: Realme is set to launch the Realme 16 Pro in India on January 6, 2026. The smartphone features a 200MP LumaColor camera, a 7000mAh battery, 1.5K 144Hz AMOLED display, Dimensity 7300-Max chipset and Realme UI 7.0. Here's all we know so far.

title: If India data centre investments were landmark in 2025, look out for new players, peaks in 2026
snippet: Following a record-breaking 2025, India’s data centre industry is bracing for a 20% jump in investments in 2026, driven by an insatiable demand for artificial intelligence infrastructure.

title: At turn of year, Musk’s ‘spicy’ AI feature triggers sour response from Indian regulators
snippet: Concerns about AI-generated explicit content arise from Grok's recent feature, leading to government scrutiny in India. The Centre is calling for stricter regulations on social media platforms like X, emphasizing the need for accountability in light of rising complaints.

snippet: Apple Days Sale on Vijay Sales brings big discounts on iPhone 17 Pro Max, iPhone 16 series, MacBooks, iPads and Apple Watch. With bank offers and price cuts, shoppers can save up to  ₹20,000 before the sale ends.

title: Samsung Galaxy S26 and Fold 8 leaks hint at launch timeline and key upgrades. What to expect
snippet: Samsung’s 2026 flagship lineup is tipped to include the Galaxy S26 series and new foldables, with no expected price hike. Leaks suggest upgraded batteries, lighter designs, powerful new chipsets and a February launch for the S26 range.

Delhi govt agrees in principle to allow privately-owned EVs to operate as shared taxis
snippet: The Delhi government has agreed in principle to allow privately-owned electric vehicles to operate as shared taxis, even as cab aggregators have said they will roll out shared rides that will also involve women drivers within a month, officials said on Friday.

title: Sprawling CES gadgetfest a world stage for AI and its hype
snippet: At CES, lofty artificial intelligence hype meets reality: today’s AI excels at narrow tasks, not autonomy. Analysts from Forrester warn of widening gaps, amid smart gadgets, chip rivalries, rising costs, and geopolitical trade pressures shaping consumer tech this year globally.

title: President Trump orders divestment in $2.9 million chips deal to protect US security interests
snippet: President Donald Trump on Friday ordered the unravelling of a $2.9 million computer chips deal that he concluded threatened US security interests if the current owner, HieFo Corp, remained in control of the technology.

title: India to showcase AI case studies to global leaders at upcoming Summit

title: Electronics production plugs into over Rs 41.5k crore investments
snippet: The approved projects—spread across eight states and led by subsidiaries of Foxconn, Tata Electronics, Samsung, TDK, Wipro and Hindalco—are expected to generate production worth Rs 2.58 lakh crore and create 33,791 direct jobs, the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) said.

title: Gig workers’ strike revives debate on 10-minute delivery
snippet: More than 200,000 delivery workers operating for platforms such as Zomato, Blinkit, Swiggy, Instamart, Zepto, Amazon and Flipkart went on a strike on December 31, seeking better payments and social security benefits.

title: Labour Ministry proposes 90-day annual work threshold for gig worker social security
snippet: The Labour Ministry has proposed a 90-day annual work threshold as the mandatory eligibility criteria for gig and platform workers to access social security under new draft rules on the Social Security Code 2020, published on December 31. title: Zomato delivery partners’ hourly earnings rose 10.9% in 2025: Eternal CEO Deepinder Goyal
snippet: Average earnings per hour for delivery partners on Zomato rose to Rs 102 in 2025, up from Rs 92 in 2024, marking a 10.9% year-on-year increase, according to a fact sheet released by Eternal CEO Deepinder Goyal on X.
